definition: to be suspicious and jealous of
to be jealous of/fear/dread/scruple/to avoid or abstain from/to quit/to give up sth

sentences.english: wives could be kept in purdah by jealous, fearful husbands.
sentences.chinese: 妻子可能會被生心猜忌，擔心的丈夫限制於深閨中。

sentences.english: Believe that cigarette packaging rotogravure printing ink needs will increase.
sentences.chinese: 猜忌菸包不凸版油墨的需求也會因此補充。

sentences.english: I'am tired of all these jealousies and quarrels.
sentences.chinese: 我膩煩了這些猜忌和爭吵。

sentences.english: Historians have long been puzzled by dots, lines and symbols.
sentences.chinese: 歷史學家始終被一些點，線和標記感應猜忌疑惑。

sentences.english: Don't let suspicion louse up a good marriage.
sentences.chinese: 不要讓猜忌毀了一段好姻緣。

sentences.english: He snatched the pistol back, jealously; shut the knife, and returned it to its concealment.
sentences.chinese: 他猜忌地把手槍奪回去，合攏刀子，又把它藏回原處。

sentences.english: Two apprehensive aspects are doubtable appropriately.
sentences.chinese: 兩個可疑的方面分辨受到猜忌。

definition: to hate out of jealousy/to resent
to resent/to harbor a grudge against/to loathe/resentment/rancor
to attack sb by exposing faults/to denounce
to be jealous of (sb's achievements etc)/to be envious/envy
to feel hatred/to harbor a grudge
scramble for power and profit (idiom); power struggle
